level.text: The Director may consider the following factors in determining whether the Department should cause correction of a violation:
The status of any current assessments against the property;
The financial status of the property including whether the property is in either foreclosure or receivership, or has been abandoned;
The physical condition of the property including whether there are any major structural problems;
The current vacancy rate of the property, if a housing accommodation;
The amount of funds needed to make the correction in relation to market value of the property;
The prospect of timely repayment of the funds expended including whether there is an active Tenant’s Association paying funds into an escrow account;
The best interests of the tenants in being provided safe and sanitary conditions; and
Any other factors which the Director deems relevant.
